title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Hello,

I've received a board from an a1990.
But actually the board is in a pretty bad condition..
PPBUS_G3H is shorted.

there is some big scratches in the board but I have the hope that it is fixable. Can someone help me?

Mac 1 is near UA550
Mac 2 is near CA903
Mac 3 is near R2724
Mac 4 is near R8171
Mac 5 is near QK092

your help will be really appreciated.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Board looks very ugly.
What is the exact ohm value to ground at PPBUS_G3H?
Compare with all big coils; possibly short caused by a high-side MOSFET.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Thank you really much ! I appreciate it.

all measured to ground they are all between 0.4 and 0.5 ohms.
PPBUS_G3H is 0.4 ohms to ground.
C3502 = 0.4 ohms
C3504 = 0.4 ohms
C3503 = 0.5 ohms
R3461  = 0.5 ohms
R3451  = 0.5 ohms
C5455 = 0.4 ohms
C6456 = 0.5 ohms

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
That is really short.
I was waiting to see L7211/21/31, L7330 and L7410/20 resistance to ground.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
My bad, I didn't understand, but here it is:
L7211        2.8 ohm 
L7231         infinite (1)
L7221        infinite (1)
L7330        19-20 ohm
L7410        5.5 ohm
L7420        5.6 ohm

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Should be safe to inject voltage into PPBUS_G3H then; possibly shorted filter cap.
However, check first ohm value on other coils.

Start injecting 1V and slowly go up, if needed.
Set amp limit to max on lab PSU.

"L7211        2.8 ohm
L7231         infinite (1)
L7221        infinite (1)"
Are you really sure??
All are connected together, check schematic...

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Hello, 

Thanks for your help, I've been able to find were the short could potentially be.

after verification big coils are not infinite but 2.8. 

I injected some voltage in PPBUS_G3H, and with isopropyl I found that C9574 was getting really hot. So I changed the cap, and the problem was still the same... actually my power station wasn't allowing me to put more than 1,6v, and the cap was still over heating.  I found that R5630 was the junction between  PPBUS_G3H_SSD1_SNS and PPBUS_G3H; and by removing R5630 (was corroded), I'm able to inject more than 2v on PPBUS_G3H. I don't have any piece like this one so I'm going to buy it and replace it.

Do you think the problem for PPBUS_G3H shorted could come from there?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
If a CPU power chip is shorted, very likely you've already fried the CPU.
Why don't you read related posts on the forum???
So many times I explained how NOT to inject voltage into PPBUS_G3H...

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
I realise now that i’ve done some dumb things.
I’m new at this. Usually i was only repairing boards with CD32 burned. That’s the first one that i have to repair this way.
And i’m french, so i dont understand all in the forums topics.
I think that the cpu is fine. Because i ddnt put a lot of voltage in. And as i found all the broken components, i think that the cpu havnt been fried. They arent  related to cpu.

Btw thanks for your advice. I can only hope that the board can still be fixed (Hopefully it isnt for a customer).

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
You MUST compare ohm value to ground at PPBUS_G3H with all big coils, especially CPU ones.
An equal value can be sign of shorted high-side MOSFET connected to that coil.
This imply direct connection between PPBUS_G3H and coil.
If that coil is connected to CPU, where the injected voltage went?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
By measuring ohm to ground for all big coils I get
2.8 ohms for L7221 L7231 L7211
LA 340-640-650 3.7 ohms
LA 350 45 ohms
LA 300 82 ohms

As i understand, the problem could come from a high side mosfet connected to L7221-31-11. 
Could it be R7230, R7220 or R7210?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message: One of U7210/20/30 is shorted.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Thank you really much, I was able to find the short.

L5199 is gone, and the trace too.. so I know that I need to make a jumper between C5101 (1)  and J5100 pin 22. For PP5V_G3S I think that I will have to do a really long jumper, but I don't know where to start and were to end?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
L5199 is before C5100/01.
You must bring 5V_G3S to one of these caps.
I supposed to have continuity from these caps to J5100.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
After bringing back continuity, PPBUS_G3H came to 12v (with charger plugged). but the computer still don't wanna boot.
L7211/21/31 are all around 3.2 ohms.
Could the problem be repaired with dfu restore?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
"I was able to find the short."
Which was the culprit, did you change it?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message: The culprit was L5199 that was ripped of the board, C5100/01 were too, so I put back C5100/01 bc the trace wasn't gone. And I made a jumper to bring PP5V_G3S to C5100. I also made a jumper between C5100 and J5100.

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
I have my doubts about that.
How can L5199 generate short on PPBUS_G3H???
It is connected to 5V_G3S...

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
I'm not sure, but the only other solution was that the short was created by R5630. And by removing it the short disappeared...
But actually the big coils are still the same resistance. Is that meaning that there is still a short? If yes, should I remove them 1 by 1 to find who is the culprit?

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message: Do you mean R5630 is removed now???

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message: Yes, but i dont have another component  like that. So i will let this board for a moment. Thanks for your help

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message:
Be sure no short on any pads of R5630.
I was thinking you've already found the bad CPU power supply chip (U72x0).

title: 820-01041 no power, short on PPBUS_G3H bad board
message: No problem, i’ll do updates when i can go further with this one.
